div.p:
"In partnership with the community, we will make the most of every day for every student by empowering them with the skills, knowledge, values and opportunities to thrive."
-- Mr. Richard Stokes, Superintendent

a.title: Infinite Campus
a.style: text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; text-decoration: underline;

a.title: Click Here to View All News

p.a: Click Here to View All News

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Coaches Give Virtual Shout Out to Spring Athletes

a.title: Coaches Give Virtual Shout Out to Spring Athletes

div.a: Coaches Give Virtual Shout Out to Spring Athletes
div.div: The Carson High School Athletic Department and Spring sports coaches give a special message to senior athletes virtually in a video "shout out." The video was produced by Sherri Kelley, web design teacher at CHS. Go here to watch the video.
div.a: Read More about Coaches Give Virtual Shout Out to Spring Athletes

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Update: Remote Teaching Process to Continue Through June 3, 2020

a.title: Update: Remote Teaching Process to Continue Through June 3, 2020

div.a: Update: Remote Teaching Process to Continue Through June 3, 2020
div.div: In response to Nevada Gov. Sisolak’s announcement to extend the “Distance Learning” directive through the remainder of the school year, the Carson City School District will fall in compliance and continue with Remote Learning for teachers and students through June 3, 2020.
div.a: Read More about Update: Remote Teaching Process to Continue Through June 3, 2020

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Free Family Engagement Webinars

div.div: Partnership Carson City is teaming up with Carson High School, presenting a free family engagement webinar series to help promote health and wellness for youth and adults alike.
div.a: Read More about Free Family Engagement Webinars

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Pass/Fail Grading Benefits Students Without Negative Consequences

a.title: Pass/Fail Grading Benefits Students Without Negative Consequences

div.a: Pass/Fail Grading Benefits Students Without Negative Consequences
div.div: The Carson City School District will transition all secondary students to a Pass/Fail grading system for the second semester of the 2019-2020 school year. The decision comes as principals, instructional leaders, district-level administrators and members of the teachers’ union have discussed the extension of school closures following spring break.
div.a: Read More about Pass/Fail Grading Benefits Students Without Negative Consequences

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled CHS Awash With Light in Honor of Class of 2020

a.title: CHS Awash With Light in Honor of Class of 2020

div.a: CHS Awash With Light in Honor of Class of 2020
div.div: Last night, Carson High School turned on the lights on the football, soccer, track and baseball fields for 20 minutes from 8:20-8:40 p.m. (20:20 to 20:40) in support of their 2020 Graduating Class, Spring Sport Athletes, Coaches, Staff and those on the front lines fighting COVID-19.
div.a: Read More about CHS Awash With Light in Honor of Class of 2020

br.br: The Carson City School District does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability and age, and it provides equal access to the Boy Scouts of America and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the District's non-discrimination policies: Title IX and 504 Coordinator, 1402 W. King Street, Carson City, NV 89703, (775) 283-2130.

p.span: Mrs. Tasha Fuson, Associate Superintendent Educational Services
Dr. Jose Delfin, Associate Superintendent Human Resources
